title: Authenticating to the REST API
description: This endpoint allows you to authenticate to the GitHub REST API to access more endpoints and have a higher rate limit. It provides information about different ways to authenticate, such as using a personal access token, a token generated by a GitHub App, the built-in GITHUB_TOKEN in a GitHub Actions workflow, or basic authentication with a client ID and secret.

endpoint.description: API endpoint for authenticating to the REST API

method.description: HTTP method used for the request

Authorization.description: Bearer token, client ID and secret, or GITHUB_TOKEN for authentication

contentType.description: Content type of the request body

status.description: HTTP status code of the response

message.description: Response message indicating successful authentication or error details
